venue.name: Weston Center Green

item.description:
I did this route last weekend and it was simply stunning. Absolutely beautiful quiet, shady country lanes punctuated by water courses orchards, horses, and scenic vistas.  Two sustained climbs but nothing insurmountable and the rewards are a pair of lovely descents.  One of them goes by the Nashoba winery and brewery, if we hit it right it could be a PERFECT place for a lunch or cliff bar break to enjoy the view over the orchards.  I think it makes sense to start early and depending on the size of the group we'll try to keep an average speed around 15mph.  That average will likely have a wide sigma however and will be at times as high as 20 or as low as stopped (just a heads up).  We'll rally frequently and as needed to keep the group close.

Weston Center has a good amount of parking at this time on a Sunday so it shouldn't be an issue.  There is a Bruegger's Bagels Bakery a bit up the road from the meeting spot if folks need breakfast/bathrooms.

Cue sheet is in the group files ("More" menu above then "files").

I'd expect to finish by say 1 or 2pm

Things to bring:

  • Road bike in good working order
  • Flat kit (Spare tube, tire levers, patch kit, frame pump or CO2)
  • Sunblock
  • Pocket food
  • Sports drink (plenty of it)
  • Ca$h to replenish any of the above
